meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tan or light brown in color.
meanings.sent1: The tawniness of the sand on the beach made it look like a giant sandbox.
meanings.sent2: Her skin had a natural tawniness that glowed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The tawniness of the teddy bear's fur made it blend perfectly with the wooden floor.
meanings.sent4: The tawniness of the old photograph gave it a nostalgic feel, like a sepia-toned memory.
meanings.sent5: The tawniness of the autumn leaves painted the forest in warm hues of gold and brown.

meanings.definition: The appearance of being sun-kissed or golden.
meanings.sent1: The tawniness of her skin after a day at the beach was a testament to her love for the sun.
meanings.sent2: The tawniness of the ripe wheat fields shimmered in the afternoon light.
meanings.sent3: His tawniness after a day of gardening made him look like a walking sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The tawniness of the sunset painted the sky in shades of gold and amber.
meanings.sent5: The tawniness of the lion's mane gave it a majestic and radiant appearance.

meanings.sent1: The tawniness of the clay pots added a rustic charm to the garden.
meanings.sent2: The tawniness of the wooden table brought a cozy feel to the room.
meanings.sent3: The tawniness of the bread crust gave it a deliciously toasted flavor.
meanings.sent4: The tawniness of the desert sand stretched endlessly under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The tawniness of the cabin walls blended harmoniously with the surrounding trees.
